column4: description
A field for recording the unique identifier for a sample in a wide, or combined long and wide table.
Airport IATA code for sampling, used as a parent site ID for organizing sub-sites in the airport.
A geographic area, physical space, or structure. A sample is taken from a sampleshed for a representative measurement of a substance(s) in a wide, or combined long and wide table.
A field for recording the unique identifier for a site in a wide, or combined long and wide table.
A field for reporting the attribute of a site, which specifies the population of/population served by a given site in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
For integrated time averaged samples this is the date, time and timezone the sample was started being taken in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
The type of sample collection in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
Composite collection number.period in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
Binary indicator for whether a sample is pooled/made by combining multiple distinct samples.
Date, time, and timezone of when the analysis was started.
Date, time, and timezone of when the analysis was completed.
The fraction of the wastewater used for analysis and measurement.
The type of sample.
The value for either the PCR method used, or the sequencing strategy used to obstain a measure in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
Reference link for a specific protocol.
The genetic "target type" as defined using ODM classes  in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
The genetic target or measure of an analysis  in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
Value for an unlisted genetic target for either a mutation, an allele, or a variant  in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
Measure value  in a wide or combined long-and-wide table where most details are recorded in other columns.
The unit of a measure in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
The aggregation of a measure in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
The reference link for a sequencing measure in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
Chemical oxygen demand in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
Biochemical oxygen demand in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
Wastewater or water conductivity  in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
pH of a site in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
Notal nitrogen concentration at a site in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
Limit of Detection of a wastewater sample in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
Limit of quantification in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
Date that the measurement was reported to authorities in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
Contact email address in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
Notes on a measure in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
The dataset or source dataset for a measure. This might reference difference contributor organizations to a larger dataset.
The unique identifier for an organization with jurisdiction over a given site.
The unique identifier for the polygon/sewershed boundaries for collection point.
The unique identifier for a sampling site.
The social context of the sampling site, specifying the building or location type. For example, an airplane, or a school, or a wastewater treatment plant.
The type of site for collection in terms of the physical infrastructure. For example, a branch sewer pipeline, or a holding tank.
The population served by a site.
The unique identifier for a sample.
The date and time of sample collection.
The type of sample collection used to gather the sample (ie. Passive sample, grab sample, etc.)
Used for composite samples, this specifies the time period for sample collection.
Used for composite samples, this specifies the number of sub-samples taken for build the composite.
A binary indicaotr for whether the sample is pooled or not.
The date and time that analysis was started.
The date and time when analysis was complete.
The fraction of the wastewater used for analysis and measurement.
The type of material that comprises the sample (ie. Primary effluent, de-watered solids, etc.)
The PCR method used for measuring genes of interest.
The URL or link to the materials or details on the analysis protocol.
The genetic "target type" as defined using ODM groups in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
The genetic target or measure of an analysis  in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
Measure value  in a wide or combined long-and-wide table where most details are recorded in other columns.
The unit of a measure in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
The aggregation of a measure in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
Chemical oxygen demand in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
Biochemical oxygen demand in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
Wastewater or water conductivity  in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
pH of a site in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
Notal nitrogen concentration at a site in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
Limit of Detection of a wastewater sample in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
Limit of quantification in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
Date that the measurement was reported to authorities in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
Contact email address in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
Notes on a measure in a wide or combined long-and-wide table.
